name: Shetland Fishermen's Association
goal:
The Shetland Fishermen?s Association promotes the interests of around 80 members, mainly in the political arena: in government and in parliament in Scotland, the United Kingdom and the European Union. It has three sub-committees representing pelagic, white fish and small boat interests, and policy is formulated by an annually-elected executive committee. The chairman and executive officer of the SFA are tasked with ensuring the committees have the advice and information they require to make decisions and representing the organisation and promoting its policies in a wide range of different settings.

The SFA also pursues training opportunities for its members through the Shetland Fishing Training Association and the NAFC Marine Centre in Scalloway. It operates a Group Life Assurance Scheme on behalf of its members.
euInitiatives: Regular meetings with MEPs and Commission officials
